content: I am aware of other talks happening at the Topos Institute; are there existing threads for this somewhere? @Tim Hosgood is this an appropriate stream in which to start them?
Specifically I know that @Gurkenglas is interested in discussing a categorical foundation for Scott Garrabant's talk on finite factored sets.
when were these talks given? i'm not aware of any other seminars currently running, but maybe this was some talk given at the AI safety summit recently?
On Youtube it's in the playlist "Finding the right abstractions" on the Topos Institute channel.

ah yes, this is from the AI safety summit. there's not a specific zulip thread for this, so feel free to just start a new thread wherever best suits. not sure if there's a stream for discussion of papers/talks (@Matteo Capucci (he/him) ?)
I guess that snce this summit was a "by invitation only" get-together, it wasn't advertised here. But the videos are available so people should feel free to talk about 'em!

Tim Hosgood said:

ah yes, this is from the AI safety summit. there's not a specific zulip thread for this, so feel free to just start a new thread wherever best suits. not sure if there's a stream for discussion of papers/talks (Matteo Capucci (he/him) ?)

uh, there's not a specific one
I'm always wary of creating new streams... After all, these would be topics 'starting from' a talk, but of general interest
But if you feel like they deserve their own stream is fine for me
I started a topic on the other stream, but @Gurkenglas hasn't come back to see it yet, I think. I'll give them a nudge, the ideas were interesting.
